author: pawandhananjay
content:
regarding this https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/issues/3103
If we add a proposer signature on the sidecar, what would we be signing? if we sign the sidecar's merkle root, the hashing costs would be similar to time it takes for `validate_blobs_sidecar`

author: bridge-bot
content: <inphi> could you provide some more details on the hashing cost? How does it compare with 256kb blobs?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<inphi> ah right, thanks. We'll be signing the merkle root of the sidecar. At the community call we discussed this and are favoring kzg proof verification. If it becomes an issue in the future/postupgrade, we can always switch to signature verification.
We'll discuss this again at the next community call so feedback is still welcome.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> > <dannyryan>  I want to be careful about adding verification per hop and at least make it moderately future proof to do it the same way we'd do if 256kb vs 1MB (that is if the time is untenable at 1MB then that's a bit of a red flag).

That said, you're right on the merklization of the large payload. If that is of the same computational complexity as doing the kzg verification, then signing def doesn't make sense
